intro: Commicarpus plumbagineus, commonly known as the yellow sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by capsule fruits containing seeds. Its leaves are typically hairy and adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. Commicarpus plumbagineus is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is well-suited to harsh, semi-desert conditions.
